content.description: Right next to Pigeon Wings. This climbs the obvious roofs then intersects with the top face portion of Pigeon Wings (9 bolts). Some foot/hand holds are prone to flaking off, be mindful of pulling off flakes.
content.location:
Located on the south face of castle rock next to

Pigeon Wings

chimney.

content.description: Pigeon Wings is the large chimney that splits the south face of Castle Rock.Get past the bird gauno. Chicken wing, jam, stem, slither your way up from a wide chimney over a huge boulder/chockstone, then into a roof/bulge with a hand/fist crack exit. Beware of the pigeons and the guano.
content.protection:
Gear to 6" (but all the prime gear is small)

Couple runners
content.location: Located on the south face of Castle Rock, the large chimney can not be missed.

content.description: A challenging route with a good position and length but the poor bolting and contrived run-outs make this a seldom led route.
content.location:
Located between

Grappling Hooks

and

King of the Castle

.

climbs.name: King of the Castle
climbs.fa: Sam Owings, Jack Marshall, Cecilia Hernandez 5-25-2014

content.description: Climbs the beautiful arete between Kremlin Wall (on the left) and Knightline (on the right).
content.protection: 11 Bolts to a ring anchor lower off
content.location: Far right side of the south face.

content.description: Climbs the arete bulge to the left of Pigeon Wings chimney (9 bolts). Use the tiny flakes and arete of the chimney. Many holds are flaking off, be mindful of pulling off flakes. Variation to the left that follows 5 bolts and up, or continue on the arete portion to the top.
content.location: Located to the left of Pigeon Wings chimney on the south face of Castle Rock.

climbs.name: Grappling Hooks
climbs.fa: Unknown, FFA: Unknown, Face Variation:  Aidan Maguire, 1990

content.description: Located to the right of the roofs. Climb the thin dihedral that was once an aid ladder (3 old bolts), and moving up the face for the variation (.11) or you can continue up Castle Crack to finish (10c/d).
content.protection: Standard rack . Triples of .5 and at least one brassie.
content.location: Located on the south face of Castle Rock, on the right side of Pigeon Wings and The Roofs, is the clean dihedral with the 3 old school button head bolts/hangers. Can not be missed.

content.description:
Located to the right of Pigeon Wings and The Roofs. Starts off in a

thin crack. Meander up and left (10d) or right (10c) to a small alcove, then work your way up the groove.Some call it the best crack in the SB's,that is debatable with the actual amount of crack climbing the name suggests…
content.location: Located on the south face of Castle Rock, to the right of Pigeon Wings and The Roofs and to the left of Grappling Hooks (dihedral)
